head.title: One Killed and 4 Are Hurt in Brooklyn Shootout

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New York

hedline.hl1: One Killed and 4 Are Hurt in Brooklyn Shootout

block.p: A shootout involving four young men and two security guards on Sunday evening left a 21-year-old man dead and four others wounded at a private apartment complex in Brooklyn, the police said.

The gunfire erupted just before 7:30 P.M. in a laundry room at 3415 Neptune Avenue, one of six high-rise buildings that make up the Bay Park apartment complex on Coney Island, said Officer Debra Kearns, a police spokeswoman.
A shootout involving four young men and two security guards on Sunday evening left a 21-year-old man dead and four others wounded at a private apartment complex in Brooklyn, the police said.

The gunfire erupted just before 7:30 P.M. in a laundry room at 3415 Neptune Avenue, one of six high-rise buildings that make up the Bay Park apartment complex on Coney Island, said Officer Debra Kearns, a police spokeswoman.

The man killed in the shootout, Carvin Souffrint of Queens, was hit first by a bullet in the jaw inside the laundry room in an attack that the police said might have been revenge for an earlier incident.
Mr. Souffrint then fled across a courtyard to the main entrance of an adjacent building, where two apartment security guards shot him, Officer Kearns said. He died later at Coney Island Hospital.

Bill Stuttig, spokesman for the Grenadier Realty Corporation, which owns the apartment complex and the security company, Security Plus Service Inc., said Mr. Souffrint "turned around and pointed a gun at the security guards."
Jack Florival, 21, of 3325 Neptune Avenue, was charged with attempted murder in connection with the shootout, Officer Kearns said.

Those injured were Howard Downing, 22, of 3415 Neptune Avenue; Kiwin Peeples, 23, of 205 Franklin Avenue in Fort Greene, Brooklyn; Mr. Florival, and a 39-year-old male bystander whose name was not released, Officer Kearns said.
